title: Executive Order 14194—Imposing Duties To Address the Situation at Our Southern Border
Summary: An Executive Order imposes an additional 25 percent ad valorem tariff on all articles that are products of Mexico, effective February 4, 2025, to address the national emergency at the southern border.

Trump, P

title: Executive Order 14193—Imposing Duties To Address the Flow of Illicit Drugs Across Our Northern Border
Summary: The executive order imposes additional ad valorem tariffs on articles that are products of Canada, effective February 4, 2025, to address the flow of illicit drugs.

title: Executive Order 14257—Regulating Imports With a Reciprocal Tariff To Rectify Trade Practices That Contribute to Large and Persistent Annual United States Goods Trade Deficits
Summary: This Executive Order establishes a reciprocal tariff to address large and persistent U.S. goods trade deficits caused by a lack of reciprocity in bilateral trade relationships and disparate tariff and non-tariff barriers.

title: Executive Order 14259—Amendment to Reciprocal Tariffs and Updated Duties as Applied to Low-Value Imports From the People's Republic of China
Summary: The United States is increasing tariffs on goods imported from China in response to retaliatory tariffs imposed by China.

title: Executive Order 14266—Modifying Reciprocal Tariff Rates To Reflect Trading Partner Retaliation and Alignment
Summary: Tariff rates on imports from China are modified to increase duties in response to retaliatory actions and to address trade deficits and industrial policies.

title: Executive Order 14289—Addressing Certain Tariffs on Imported Articles
Summary: This Executive Order modifies existing tariffs by establishing a non-stacking procedure to prevent cumulative tariff rates from exceeding intended policy goals on certain imported articles.

title: Proclamation 10947—Adjusting Imports of Aluminum and Steel Into the United States
Summary: Tariffs on steel articles and derivative steel articles are increased from 25 percent ad valorem to 50 percent ad valorem, effective June 4, 2025.

title: Proclamation 10925—Amendments to Adjusting Imports of Automobiles and Automobile Parts Into the United States
Summary: This proclamation modifies the existing tariff system on imported automobiles and automobile parts to more effectively eliminate national security threats by adjusting duties based on domestic assembly and parts value.

title: Fact Sheet: President Donald J. Trump Imposes Tariffs on Imports from Canada, Mexico and China
Summary: President Donald J. Trump has imposed tariffs on imports from Canada, Mexico, and China.

title: Fact Sheet: President Donald J. Trump Declares National Emergency to Increase our Competitive Edge, Protect our Sovereignty, and Strengthen our National and Economic Security
